articles.title: Criminals need just 20 images of your child to produce a deep fake version of them - here’s how to keep their data safe
articles.description: Millions of parents share pictures of their children online every day, but tech experts warn these images could expose them to serious risks and long-term problems, such as identity theft and fraud, as well as extortion and exploitation, allowing cyber criminals to create bank accounts and claim benefits in their name.

articles.title: Wealthtech startup PowerUp Money raises $7 million from Accel, Blume, others
articles.description: The fresh funds will be used for strengthening the research vertical, building more products to cater to consumer requirements, and scaling up customer acquisition. The startup, which was built within Uni Cards, has now been hived off completely into a separate entity.

articles.title: EvilProxy & ClickFix attacks pose new challenge for email security
articles.description: Barracuda warns that updated EvilProxy phishing and new ClickFix social engineering attacks are challenging email security worldwide by evading detection methods.

articles.title: My Favorite Portable iPhone Charger Is 35% Off in All Colors
articles.description: The ultra-convenient Anker 622 MagGo snaps neatly onto the back of my iPhone, and I take it everywhere I go. The price just dropped to $31 across the board at Amazon.

articles.title: Apple Intelligence Is Gambling on Privacy as a Killer Feature
articles.description: Many new Apple Intelligence features happen on your device rather than in the cloud. While it may not be flashy, the privacy-centric approach could be a competitive advantage.

articles.title: Samsung Releases New Refrigerator Software Update To Improve User Convenience
articles.description: Bespoke AI refrigerators deliver seamless home experiences through software updates, including personalized settings through Voice ID feature

articles.title: Mark Your Calendars: Apple's Back-to-School Sale Reportedly Starts Soon
articles.description: School might be out for summer, but Apple’s annual education discounts could be here as soon as June 17, according to Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman.

articles.title: Blue Origin Eyes Aug. 15 For New Glenn Flight 2
articles.description: Blue Origin is aiming to launch its second New Glenn rocket no earlier than Aug. 15.

articles.title: Where to get the Nintendo Switch 2 today? Here is all on price, store info and more
articles.description: Whether you are an avid Nintendo fan or just new to gaming, this console does seem to be a good option

articles.title: Sam Altman claims an average ChatGPT query uses ‘roughly one fifteenth of a teaspoon’ of water
articles.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, in a blog post published Tuesday, says an average ChatGPT query uses about 0.000085 gallons of water, or “roughly one fifteenth of a teaspoon.”
